DOC.detailed_description: Patients Methods : Inclusion criterion : 1 : All > 18 year old patient refer transradial coronary angiography . Exclusion criterion : 1 . Absence informed consent . 2 . Known allergy nitroglycerin . 3 . Ad-hoc PCI 4 . Previous ipsilateral TRA . 5 . Warfarin NOAC therapy . 6 . Systolic blood pressure < 100 mmHg . 7 . Critical aortic stenosis ( AVA < 0.6 sq.cm ) 8 . Inability administer unfractionated heparin . 9 . Need post-procedural use heparin ( UFH , LMWH ) 10 . Raynaud 's disease . 11 . Sheathless technique use > 11 cm sheath . 12 . History intractable headache cause OR Migraine headache . Transradial Access Procedure : After routine preparation sterile draping , skin distal flexor aspect forearm infiltrate 1-2 ml preservative free 1 % lidocaine , 2-3 fingerbreaths styloid process . A 5 french , 11 cm hydrophilic introducer sheath ( Radiofocus , Terumo Medical ) outer diameter 2.65 mm place guide wire radial artery . 2.5 mg Verapamil 200 mcg nitroglycerin administer via introducer sheath intraarterial fashion .
